content:
Diagnosis:		Hepatocellular carcinoma

Management:		TACE procedure 15 March 2024

Disease Status:	BCLC Stage A, single 3.2cm segment 6 lesion

Current Situation:	Post-TACE follow up review

[redacted name] attended clinic today for review following TACE procedure. He has recovered well with only mild post-embolization syndrome that resolved within 5 days. His right upper quadrant pain has completely settled. Appetite has returned to normal and he maintains good performance status (PS 0). Blood tests show stable liver function with albumin 38, bilirubin 15, INR 1.1. AFP has decreased from 120 to 85. Triple phase CT liver performed last week shows good TACE response with complete necrosis of the target lesion. No new lesions identified. Child-Pugh A5 status maintained. The plan is to continue surveillance with 3-monthly AFP and imaging. Next triple phase CT scheduled for July 2024. Will review in clinic with results.

cancer_timeline.value: Triple phase CT shows complete necrosis of target lesion, no new lesions

patient_facts.value: Stable liver function with albumin 38, bilirubin 15, INR 1.1, Child-Pugh A5

status_updates.value: Single lesion HCC treated with TACE. Good response to treatment with complete necrosis of target lesion and falling AFP
Complete necrosis of target lesion on triple phase CT
Mild post-embolization syndrome resolved within 5 days
Triple phase CT scheduled for July 2024
3-monthly AFP and imaging surveillance, clinic review with results
